alert.note: Alert for Bosque (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 7:55PM CDT until October 29 at 1:37PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... North Bosque River Near Clifton affecting Bosque County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Bosque River near Clifton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Major flooding is expected. Water will be approaching the former clifton armory and the american legion hall near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 32.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3.0 feet Thursday morning. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
